Summary I am currently in my second rotation within the Finance Rotation Program at Cisco Systems. The Finance Rotation Program (FRP) is a two-year, entry-level accelerated development program for new college graduates, which develops skills through a rotation of finance job assignments, a defined training curriculum, and exposure to senior finance leadership. The program is led by finance professionals and supported by exceptional finance managers and mentors. The program is committed to developing early-in-career employees as world-class financial leaders for exciting and successful careers within finance at Cisco. The breadth of knowledge that I have gained so far has allowed me to grow personally and professionally, at an exceptional rate.

Core duties included deal management for the Global Service Provider business within Europe's northern region. The program is led by finance professionals and supported by exceptional finance managers and mentors. The program is committed to developing early-in-career employees as world-class financial leaders for exciting and successful careers within finance at Cisco. Summary Even though the opportunity to go to college was not available to me when I moved in to this country about 12 years ago, I always knew that the only way to accomplish the well-known "American dream" was through making sacrifices and never giving up. Through commitment, dedication and the desire of becoming a professional, I was able to complete my Bachelor’s Degree in four years while also working full-time.  
 
Additionally, I got involved in various organizations in school, including the Poole College of Management Peer Leaders in which I was introduced to 10 new students who I mentored and guided through their transition to college. I also participated in a Study Abroad Program in Madrid, Spain. This opportunity allowed me to network with people from several countries. Not only this expanded my cultural background, but it also helped me to realize that my desire was to work for a company involved in communications, technology and diversity. 
 
Fortunately, when I came back from Spain, I was offered an internship at EMC. My performance in the Finance department enabled me to extend a summer internship into a full year internship. I learned about Fixed Assets management through various ERP systems including ORACLE and SAP. 
After graduating in May 2013, I was hired to be part of a Finance Rotation Program (FRP) at Cisco Systems. The participants of this program spend a year in Accounting and a year in Finance with the opportunity to complete training in finance, soft and system skills as well.  
 
I am currently part of the Business Enablement Accounting Team where I work closely with about 15 Cisco's acquisitions. My team is mainly responsible for the compliance of the acquired companies with GAAP and Corporate Policy. Additionally, my team works with the integration teams to facilitate the assimilation of the acquired companies’ accounting process into the Cisco systems and processes.
